events.organization: Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL)
events.organization_original_text: Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL)
events.role_description: Co-founded J-PAL with Esther Duflo and Sendhil Mullainathan. Remains one of J-PAL’s directors, promoting the use of scientific evidence to inform poverty alleviation strategies.
events.concurrent_with_notes: Concurrent with role as Ford Foundation International Professor of Economics at MIT

events.organization: Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL)
events.role_description: Serves as a member of J-PAL's Executive Committee, contributing to strategic decision-making and governance.
events.concurrent_with_notes: Concurrent with role as Director and other positions at MIT and J-PAL

events.organization: Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL)
events.role_description: Serves as Scientific Director of J-PAL Europe, overseeing research and initiatives in Europe.
events.concurrent_with_notes: Concurrent with other roles at J-PAL and MIT

events.role_description: Previously served as Co-Chair of J-PAL’s Education sector, leading initiatives in education research and policy.
events.concurrent_with_notes: Concurrent with other roles at J-PAL and MIT

events.organization: Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL)
events.role_description: Previously served as Co-Chair of J-PAL's Innovations in Government Initiative, focusing on innovative governance solutions.

events.role_description: Conducted research and taught economics at MIT, leading to the eventual appointment as Ford Foundation International Professor of Economics in 2003.

events.role_title: Ford Foundation International Professor of Economics
events.role_description: Appointed as Ford Foundation International Professor of Economics, continuing research and teaching in economics, with a focus on development economics and poverty alleviation.

events.role_title: Co-director, Lemann Center for Development, Education and Public Policy
events.role_description: Co-directing the newly-established Lemann Center for Development, Education and Public Policy at the UZH Faculty of Business, Economics, and Informatics. The center was created following a 26 million franc donation from the Lemann Foundation.
